metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4442 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
Password Generator (aka Pwgen) before 2.07 uses weak pseudo generatednumbers when /dev/urandom is unavailable, which makes it easier forcontext-dependent attackers to guess the numbers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4442` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pwgen - 3.3.8-3ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pwgen package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-3ubuntu2').
